class.name: NoiseTexture
class.brief_description: A texture filled with noise generated by a [Noise] object.
class.description: Uses [FastNoise], [OpenSimplexNoise] or other libraries to fill the texture data of your desired size. NoiseTexture can also generate normalmap textures. The class uses [Thread]s to generate the texture data internally, so [method Texture.get_data] may return [code]null[/code] if the generation process has not completed yet. In that case, you need to wait for the texture to be generated before accessing the data: [codeblock] var texture = preload("res://noise.tres") yield(texture, "changed") var image = texture.get_data() [/codeblock]

members.member: If [code]true[/code], the resulting texture contains a normal map created from the original noise interpreted as a bump map.
Strength of the bump maps used in this texture. A higher value will make the bump maps appear larger while a lower value will make them appear softer.
If [code]true[/code], inverts the noise texture. White becomes black, black becomes white.
If [code]true[/code], a seamless texture is requested from the Noise object.
